theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma'i bstan bcos kyi tshig dang don gyi cha rgya cher bsnyad pa phra ba'i don gsal ba zhes bya ba | Clarifier of subtle meaning – Extensive commentary on the words and meanings of the Mahāyānottaratantraśāstra

|| bcom ldan 'das ma pham pa la phyag tshal lo || I bow down to the Fortunate one, the Invincible one (i.e., Maitreya).
gang gis rang gi rang bzhin dri med 'khor ba'i khong gnas pa ||
zab yangs skyob pa'i gsung dang zag med zhi ba'i lam brten pas ||
legs rtogs sgrib myed blo mnga' rgya che 'od zer stong 'bar ba ||
zhi ba'i 'khor lo dam pas tshogs rnams rmin mdzad
de la gus pas 'dud || I respectfully bow down to the one (i.e. Maitreya) who abides in the saṃsāra with his stainless own-nature, who, depending both on the extensive and profond teachings of the protector (i.e. the Buddha) and on the uncontaminated path, who hence has the unobstructed wisdom of realization, who shines forth with thousands of extensive rays, and who brings to maturation groups (of beings) by means of the excellent wheel of pacification.
ma pham rgyal sras dam pa'i zhal gyi bum pa bzang po nas ||
mngon 'byung theg
mchog nges dondan dam chos bdud rtsi dri myed pa ||
blo ngan rlomrlob pa'i yid can ngan skyugs dri mas ma lcags shing ||
'gro ba'i mi shes nad gsol 'jig rten 'di na rigs gnas rgyal |||| May this stainless nectar — he excellent teaching of definitive meaning of the excellent vehicle, which has arisen from the auspicious vessel of the excellent Son of the victorious one, the Invicible (Ajita, Maitreya) — not be saturated with stains of the vomit of evil of the bad-minded ones, who have a conceited mind, and may it cure the disease of ignorance of the beings, And may it prevail in this world (as) the foundation that is spiritual disposition (gotra).

lg.l: brtse chen blo gros ldan ba lta ngan sgra gcan las grol zhing ||
chos kyi snang pa mchog gis blo ngan rab rib rnams bsal te ||
sa stengs 'di na nyi bzhin grags pa lham me snang gyur pa ||
zla myed rigs par smra barigs pas smra ba chos gyi bla ma dpal la‹la› 'dud ||

ab.note: I bow down to the auspicious (Zhang tshe spong) Chos kyi bla ma, the matchless logician who, having great compassion and intelligence, is freed from the eclipse maker (Rāhu) of wrong views, and who eliminates eye-diseases (timira) of the bad-minded people by means of excellent light of teaching, and briliantly shining forth on the earth with a sun-like glory.

body.ab:
de la bcom ldan 'das ma pham pas rgyan rnaMs pa 2 dang rnam 'byed rnam pa gnyis kyis skyob pa'i thabs la rten te rims kyis bkri ba'i laM las gdul
bya rnaMs legs par rab tu btul ste skal ba dang ldan bar gyur ba na dus phyis 'os su gyur pa'i gdul bya la mchog gi don theg pa chen po'i gsang pa dngos kyi don la blo gros gzhan gyis gnod pa med cing zhugs nas spang par bya ba ma yin pa phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi‹kyi› 'khor lo'i don rnam par 'byed pa'byed pa{} theg pa chen‹chen› po rgyud bla ma'i stan bcos 'di
'di sbyar bar mdzad do | 'di la don bzhi ste | spyi'i don lus rnaM par gzhag pa dang | 'bras bu dkon mchogdkon ‹mchog› gi don dang | de sgrub par byed pa'i rigs dang | bstan chos yongs su rdzogs pa'i bya ba'o ||

dad pa'am | ngo bo tha dad pa'am | ngo bo gcig la ldog pa tha dad pa yin zhe na | gcig pa bkag pa'i tha dad pa ma yin te | thams cad dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro | dngos po tha dad pa'i nges pa'ang myed de bag la nyal la sogs pa 'ga' zhig dngos po gcig par 'gyur ba'i go skabs yod pas so | dngos po 1 pa'i yang nges pa myed de rgyud bzhir phye ba'i rgyud tha dad pa rnaMs ngo bo tha dad par yang 'gyur ba'i
phri ro| des na dngos po gcig gam tha dad kyang bla ste mtshan nyid tha dad pa dgu yod pas sgrib pa dgu'o |

lg.l: dul ba'i tshig rnaMs dad ldan skye bo'i rnarsnar snyan cing ||
skye bo ngan gang mthong na snying la zug rnu skyed byed ngag ||
legs par bshad pa'ang gzhan la phan par su zhig seMs ||

ab.note: The words of those disciplined [in....] are sweet to the ear of faithful people. Who would think that it is beneficial for others to explain correctly words that generate pain in the heart when seen by bad people.

lg.l:
gang dang gang dag mngon sangs rgyas pa'i
zhing mchog der ||
blo dman rtogs pas dbul zhing rnyedsnyed la gdu ba dang ||
chos dang gang zag mchog la sdang par zhugs pa'i ||
skye bo ngan ba'i tshogs kyis phyogs kun dben gyur cig ||

ab.note: In each and every excellent field of complete awakening May all directions be empty of the flocks of bad men Who engage hatefuly towards the doctrine and the exellent persons, Who are of inferior mind, poor in understanding and attached to obtaining (things).

lg.l: yun ring brtson pas dkar po'i sa bon mthur ldan zhing ||
skye dang skye barba‹r› rab sbyang blo gros gsal gyur pa ||

blo ldan khyu mchog chos rje chos kyi bla ma'i
gsung ||
theg mchog don gsal byed pa dran phyir mngon bar bstus ||

ab.note: I have summarized, in order to remember the teaching of the Lord of Dharma Chos kyi bla ma, the wise excellent bull, that clarifies the meaning of the excellent vehicle, Whose mind became clear through clarification in repeated births And who has the power of the wholesome seed thanks to his long-term efforts.

lg.l: bsod naMs 'di yis skye bo dam pa de dang de ||
bdud kyi tshogs bcom rkang gnyis gtso' bor gyur pa dang ||
bdag kyang de dag rjes su byang chub mchog thob nas ||
'gro rnams zhi ba'i lam la rab du 'god gyur cig ||

ab.note: Trough these merits, may each and every excellent man become the best of the biped (i.e., a Buddha) who conquers the armies of demons, and May I, too, obtain the excellent awakening after them, and May then beings be established in the path of pacification.

lg.l: gzhan {°}ma pham chos rgyal dri myed pa sa stengssteng‹s› 'dir ||
byang chub shing dbang drung du mngon sangs rgyas pa na ||‹¦›
chos kyi seng ge blo gsal grags pa'i nyi 'od kyis ||
theg pa mchog la rmongs pa'i rab rib sel gyur cig ||

ab.note: When the Unconquered by others (i.e. Maitreya as a future buddha), the King of Doctrine, the Stainless one, will have correctly awaken under the bodhi-tree king (in Bodhgayā), on the earth, May the eye-disease (timira) of ignorance with regard to the excellent vehicle be dispelled by the glorious sun-rays of the clear-minded one, the Lion of the doctrine (Chos kyi seng ge).

body.ab: theg pa chen po rgyud bla ma'i bstan bcos kyi tshig dang don gyi cha rgya cher bsnyad pa phra ba'i don gsal ba zhes bya ba | shag kya'i dge slong chos kyi bla ma'i zhabs kyi rdul spyi bos nod pa dge slong chos kyi seng ges nye bar sbyar pa rdzogs s+hO |||| ||The “Clarifier of subtle meaning,” an extensive commentary on the words and meanings of the Mahāyānottaratantraśāstra compiled by the monk Chos kyi seng ge, who touched with his head the dust of feet of the Śākya monk Chos kyi bla ma, is completed.
